flixel.system.input.touch.FlxTouch

type
class
extends
flixel.util.FlxPoint
Helper class, contains and track touch points in your game. Automatically accounts for parallax scrolling, etc.

Constructor

new(?X : Float, ?Y : Float, ?PointID : Int)
parameters
X stageX touch coordinate
Y stageX touch coordinate
PointID touchPointID of the touch
Constructor

Instance Variables hide inherited show inherited

_current : Int

Helper variable for tracking whether the touch was just began or just ended.

_flashPoint : flash.geom.Point

_last : Int

Helper variable for tracking whether the touch was just began or just ended.

isActive(accessor,null) : Bool

Check to see if the touch is active.

justPressed(accessor,null) : Bool

Check to see if the touch was just began.

justReleased(accessor,null) : Bool

Check to see if the touch was just ended.

pressed(accessor,null) : Bool

Check to see if the touch is pressed.

screenX : Int

Current X position of the touch point on the screen.

screenY : Int

Current Y position of the touch point on the screen.

touchPointID(accessor,null) : Int

A unique identification number (as an Int) assigned to the touch point.

x(default,accessor) : Float

inherited from flixel.util.FlxPoint

y(default,accessor) : Float

inherited from flixel.util.FlxPoint

inline distanceTo(AnotherPoint : FlxPoint) : Float

inherited from flixel.util.FlxPoint
parameters
AnotherPoint A FlxPoint object to calculate the distance to.
returns
The distance between the two points as a Float.
Calculate the distance to another point.

getScreenPosition(?Camera : flixel.FlxCamera, ?point : flixel.util.FlxPoint) : flixel.util.FlxPoint

parameters
Camera If unspecified, first/main global camera is used instead.
point An existing point object to store the results (if you don't want a new one created).
returns
The touch point's location in screen space.
Fetch the screen position of the touch on any given camera. NOTE: Touch.screenX and Touch.screenY also store the screen position of the touch point on the main camera.

getWorldPosition(?Camera : flixel.FlxCamera, ?point : flixel.util.FlxPoint) : flixel.util.FlxPoint

parameters
Camera If unspecified, first/main global camera is used instead.
point An existing point object to store the results (if you don't want a new one created).
returns
The touch point's location in world space.
Fetch the world position of the touch on any given camera. NOTE: Touch.x and Touch.y also store the world position of the touch point on the main camera.

inline inCoords(RectX : Float, RectY : Float, RectWidth : Float, RectHeight : Float) : Bool

inherited from flixel.util.FlxPoint
parameters
RectX The X value of the region to test within
RectY The Y value of the region to test within
RectWidth The width of the region to test within
RectHeight The height of the region to test within
returns
True if the point is within the region, otherwise false
Returns true if this point is within the given rectangular block

inline inFlxRect(Rect : FlxRect) : Bool

inherited from flixel.util.FlxPoint
parameters
Rect The FlxRect to test within
returns
True if pointX/pointY is within the FlxRect, otherwise false
Returns true if this point is within the given rectangular block

overlaps(ObjectOrGroup : flixel.FlxBasic, ?Camera : flixel.FlxCamera) : Bool

parameters
ObjectOrGroup The object or group being tested.
Camera Specify which game camera you want. If null getScreenXY() will just grab the first global camera.
returns
Whether or not the two objects overlap.
Checks to see if some FlxObject overlaps this FlxObject or FlxGroup. If the group has a LOT of things in it, it might be faster to use FlxG.overlaps(). WARNING: Currently tilemaps do NOT support screen space overlap checks!

reset(X : Float, Y : Float, PointID : Int) : Void

Resets the just pressed/just released flags and sets touch to not pressed.

set(?X : Float, ?Y : Float) : FlxPoint

inherited from flixel.util.FlxPoint
parameters
X The X-coordinate of the point in space.
Y The Y-coordinate of the point in space.
Set the coordinates of this point object.

toString() : String

inherited from flixel.util.FlxPoint
Convert object to readable string name. Useful for debugging, save games, etc.

update() : Void

Called by the internal game loop to update the just pressed/just released flags.

updateTouchPosition(X : Float, Y : Float) : Void

parameters
X stageX touch coordinate
Y stageY touch coordinate
Function for updating touch coordinates. Called by the TouchManager.
